org.spongepowered.api.entity.player.tab

Interface TabList


  • public interface TabList
    Represents a Player's tab list.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addPlayer(PlayerTabInfo player)
      Adds a player to the list.
      Text getFooter()
      Gets this list's footer.
      Text getHeader()
      Gets this list's header.
      Optional<PlayerTabInfo> getPlayer(UUID uuid)
      Finds a PlayerTabInfo matching the specified UUID.
      List<PlayerTabInfo> getPlayers()
      Gets the players on the list.
      PlayerTabInfo removePlayer(UUID playerId)
      Removes a player from the list.
      void setFooter(Text footer)
      Sets this list's footer.
      void setHeader(Text header)
      Sets this list's header.

    • Method Detail

      • getHeader

        Text getHeader()
        Gets this list's header.
        Returns:
        The current header

      • setHeader

        void setHeader(Text header)
        Sets this list's header.
        Parameters:
        header - The new header

      • getFooter

        Text getFooter()
        Gets this list's footer.
        Returns:
        The current footer

      • setFooter

        void setFooter(Text footer)
        Sets this list's footer.
        Parameters:
        footer - The new footer

      • getPlayers

        List<PlayerTabInfo> getPlayers()
        Gets the players on the list. The list should be immutable.
        Returns:
        The players on the list

      • addPlayer

        void addPlayer(PlayerTabInfo player)
        throws IllegalArgumentException
        Adds a player to the list.
        Parameters:
        player - The player to add
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - when it attempts to add a player already on the list. This is to prevent modification of a PlayerTabInfo by overwriting it

      • removePlayer

        PlayerTabInfo removePlayer(UUID playerId)
        Removes a player from the list. This should only be used to completely remove a player, not add it back later. Note that if this is used on a player, but they remain visible in-game, their skin will not work.
        Parameters:
        playerId - the UUID of the player to remove
        Returns:
        The PlayerTabInfo that was associated with the UUID

      • getPlayer

        Optional<PlayerTabInfo> getPlayer(UUID uuid)
        Finds a PlayerTabInfo matching the specified UUID. If none were found, it returns Optional.absent().
        Parameters:
        uuid - The UUID to search for
        Returns:
        An Optional containing a PlayerTabInfo if one was found
